Uses of Interface
fr.cnrs.iees.graph.Node

  • Packages that use Node 
    Package Description
    fr.cnrs.iees.graph
    The core interfaces of the omugi library: graph, node, edge, etc.
    fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl
    Three implementations of the fr.cnrs.iees.graph interfaces.
    fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl  

    • Uses of Node in fr.cnrs.iees.graph

      Classes in fr.cnrs.iees.graph with type parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      interface  Graph<N extends Node,​E extends Edge>
      The root interface for graphs.
      interface  Graphable<N extends Node,​E extends Edge>
      An interface for objects that can be transformed into a graph
      interface  NodeSet<N extends Node>
      A Graph is defined as a G=(N,E,f) where N is a set of nodes, E a set of edges connecting the nodes, and f the incidence function mapping every edge to a pair of nodes.
      Subinterfaces of Node in fr.cnrs.iees.graph 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      interface  TreeNode

      connects this node to node and return the resulting edge (will create an edge), according to specified direction.
      default Edge Node.connectTo​(Direction direction, Node node, ReadOnlyPropertyList edgeProperties)
      connects this node to node and return the resulting edge (will create an edge), according to specified direction, adding the property list to the Edge if the EdgeFactory supports it.
